jinngine.collision
Class SweepAndPrune

java.lang.Object
  jinngine_t.collision.SweepAndPrune
All Implemented Interfaces:
BroadphaseCollisionDetection
public class SweepAndPrune
extends java.lang.Object
implements BroadphaseCollisionDetection

Sweep and Prune implementation of the BroadphaseCollisionDetection interface. Sweep and Prune is especially effective in taking advantage of temporal coherence, i.e. the fact that a physical configurations changes only slightly during one single time-step. If, on the other hand, Sweep and prune was to be applied to some obscure configuration, where object positions would change wildly during each time step, it would perform very poorly. When temporal coherence is high, the computation time is roughly linear in the number of objects.

Author:
moo

run

public void run()
Description copied from interface: BroadphaseCollisionDetection
Run the broad-phase collision detection. This call will invoke calls to any registered event handler, se BroadphaseCollisionDetection.Handler. The method overlap() in the BroadphaseCollisionDetection.Handler interface, is called when ever a new overlap between two objects arises. separation() is invoked when an overlap vanishes.

Specified by:
run in interface BroadphaseCollisionDetection
